channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Amid Scramble for Food, Prices in Gaza Reach Extraordinary Heights
item.description: Obtaining humanitarian aid can be difficult and dangerous, and though some essentials are available at markets, they are prohibitively expensive for m...

item.title: UnitedHealth Group didn’t just miss earnings, it did something far worse
item.description: In less than a month, this corporate giant had lost more than half its value.

item.title: The Fed’s Powell said the phrase ‘downside risks’ six times in his press conference yesterday—is that bad news for tomorrow’s jobs number?
item.description: The jobs number (nonfarm payrolls, to give its technical name) is due out tomorrow. Expect stocks to react strongly if it comes in weak.

item.title: Powell didn’t just refuse to deliver a rate cut—he also hinted a raise could have been on the cards
item.description: Powell put a cat among the pigeons by suggesting he was minded to "look through" tariff-induced inflation by not increasing interest rates.

item.title: Russian Missile and Drone Attack Pummels Kyiv, Killing at Least 7
item.description: The assault came soon after President Trump threatened new sanctions against Moscow if the bloodshed didn’t let up.

item.title: I’m a cybersecurity CEO who advises over 9,000 agencies and Sam Altman is wrong that the AI fraud crisis is coming—it’s already here
item.description: We may soon recognize a "Moore's Law"-style principle for AI that I call “Altman’s Law”: every 180 days, AI capabilities double.

item.title: On Eve of Tariff Deadline, Trump’s Trade War Faces Key Court Test
item.description: A federal appeals panel will hear arguments from states and businesses that seek to invalidate the president’s tariffs.

item.title: CFOs chart a course for crypto in corporate finance
item.description: Despite some concerns, finance chiefs are already making plans to adopt crypto, according to Deloitte.

item.title: After Backlash, Ukraine Votes to Restore Watchdogs’ Powers
item.description: President Volodymyr Zelensky’s move last week to neuter two anticorruption agencies drew the country’s first street protests since Russia’s invasion.

item.title: A Trade Deadline Frenzy, and Trump’s Push to Redraw Congressional Maps
item.description: Plus, why the tsunami wasn’t bigger.

item.title: Russian Drones and Missiles Strike Kyiv
item.description: Russia launched a barrage of drones and missiles on the Ukrainian capital early Thursday, killing several people and injuring dozens.

item.title: Myanmar Lifts State of Emergency, Paving the Way for Disputed Vote
item.description: The military government hopes elections can bring more international legitimacy. But the generals will still rule, and opposition groups are boycottin...

item.title: Russian Missile and Drone Attack Pummels Kyiv, Killing at Least 7
item.description: The assault came soon after President Trump threatened new sanctions against Moscow if the bloodshed didn’t let up.

item.description: President Volodymyr Zelensky’s move last week to neuter two anticorruption agencies drew the country’s first street protests since Russia’s invasion.
